devdoc.details: Step 5: Payment/Treasury contract owned by multisig  LEARNING POINT: This contract holds ETH for the collaboration. The multisig wallet (as owner) controls withdrawals, ensuring both parties must approve any fund movement. Anyone can deposit ETH.  Key concepts: - receive() function: Allows contract to receive ETH - onlyOwner modifier: Restricts withdrawals to owner (multisig) - Events: Track all deposits and withdrawals for transparency - Balance tracking: Monitor total deposits vs withdrawals

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

params.initialOwner: The address that will be the initial owner (multisig)  LEARNING POINT: We pass the multisig address as initialOwner. This way, the multisig controls the treasury from the start. Alternatively, we could deploy with deployer as owner, then transfer to multisig.

returns._0: The current balance in wei  LEARNING POINT: This is a view function (free to call). It returns the contract's current ETH balance.
The net balance in wei  LEARNING POINT: This calculates the difference between total deposits and total withdrawals. Should match getBalance() if no ETH was sent via other means.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.authorized: Whether to authorize (true) or revoke (false)  LEARNING POINT: This allows the multisig to authorize other contracts (like TaskManagement) to withdraw funds for specific purposes. This enables automatic payments while maintaining multisig control over authorization.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

withdraw(address,uint256).details: Only the owner (multisig) or authorized withdrawers can call this function

params.amount: The amount of ETH to withdraw (in wei)  LEARNING POINT: The `onlyOwner` modifier ensures only the multisig can withdraw. Since the multisig requires 2-of-2 approval, both parties must approve any withdrawal transaction. Authorized contracts (like TaskManagement) can also withdraw for specific use cases.
params.recipient: The address to send ETH to

devdoc.title: Treasury

getBalance().notice: Get the current balance of the treasury

getDeposit(uint256).notice: Get a specific deposit by index

getDepositIndices(address).notice: Get all deposit indices for an address

getWithdrawal(uint256).notice: Get a specific withdrawal by index

getWithdrawalIndices(address).notice: Get all withdrawal indices for an address

setAuthorizedWithdrawer(address,bool).notice: Authorize or revoke authorization for a contract to withdraw

userdoc.notice: A treasury contract for managing collaboration funds
